HIL v1 Interpretation Panel - Activity Domain Pilot

Purpose: Provide a human-readable summary of activity without requiring
the user to scan raw execution lists.

Backend Contract:
- GET /api/v1/activity/summary must return pre-computed aggregations
- Response must include provenance metadata
- No frontend computation allowed

Navigation:
- Clicking any metric navigates to the source execution panel
- "12 runs today" → ACT-EX-CR-O2 filtered to today
- "3 failed" → ACT-EX-CR-O2 filtered to status=failed

Implementation: Phase 3 of HIL v1 rollout

Displays a paginated list of completed LLM runs. Shows run ID, status, duration, token usage, and cost. Supports filtering by status, date range, and agent. Does NOT show live/running executions or detailed trace steps.

Provides a glanceable snapshot of current system activity. Shows count of running executions, recently completed, and at-risk. Does NOT show logs, configuration, charts, or drilldowns.

Provides a glanceable snapshot of incident status. Shows count of active, acknowledged, and resolved incidents. Attention count highlights incidents needing immediate review. Does NOT show incident details, root cause, or remediation.

Provides a glanceable snapshot of activity status. Shows total runs count and breakdown by status (success, failed, running). Attention items highlight runs needing review (long running, near budget). Does NOT show run details, traces, or costs.

Provides a glanceable snapshot of policy proposal status. Shows total proposals, breakdown by status (draft, approved, rejected), approval rate percentage, and pending count. Does NOT show proposal details, rule content, or approval history.
